title: Host Header Injection
vulnerability_information:
Reproduction

1- open reset link https://login.newrelic.com/passwords/forgot

2- Enter the victim's email address and click Reset and Email Password

3- Intercept the HTTP request in Burp Suite & add X-Forwarded Host Header and write 
attacker.com/.newrelic.com

link will be like 

https://testing-now.000webhostapp.com/.newrelic.com/passwords/reset/a248d8b06e7b25a116859729cbc0e07e180d9fb197dadc04f30185512eecc811

## Impact

The victim will receive the malicious link in their email, and, when clicked, will leak the user's password reset link / token to the attacker, leading to full account takeover.
vulnerability_information_html:
Reproduction

1- open reset link https://login.newrelic.com/passwords/forgot

2- Enter the victim's email address and click Reset and Email Password

3- Intercept the HTTP request in Burp Suite & add X-Forwarded Host Header and write
attacker.com/.newrelic.com

link will be like

https://testing-now.000webhostapp.com/.newrelic.com/passwords/reset/a248d8b06e7b25a116859729cbc0e07e180d9fb197dadc04f30185512eecc811

Impact

The victim will receive the malicious link in their email, and, when clicked, will leak the user's password reset link / token to the attacker, leading to full account takeover.

activities.message:
Hi @masterhackor,
  
Thank you for your submission! Unfortunately, this particular issue you reported is explicitly out of scope as outlined in the [Policy Page](https://hackerone.com/newrelic):  

> - Attacks requiring a Man-in-the-Middle, with no other possible exploitation
 
Your effort is nonetheless appreciated and we wish that you'll continue to research and submit any future security issues you find.

Best Regards,
@antenna
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @masterhackor,
 
Thank you for your submission! Unfortunately, this particular issue you reported is explicitly out of scope as outlined in the Policy Page: 

  • Attacks requiring a Man-in-the-Middle, with no other possible exploitation

Your effort is nonetheless appreciated and we wish that you'll continue to research and submit any future security issues you find.

Best Regards,
@antenna

additional_data.old_title: Update for my closed report at #697581 full account takeover

activities.message: While this can lead to a full account takeover, it requires unlikely user interaction: the user would have to click on the "Reset password" that they did not generate themselves, and as you show in your screenshot, we even show the site they're going to, which is not "newrelic.com". However, the main problem seems to be an open redirect.
activities.markdown_message: While this can lead to a full account takeover, it requires unlikely user interaction: the user would have to click on the "Reset password" that they did not generate themselves, and as you show in your screenshot, we even show the site they're going to, which is not "newrelic.com". However, the main problem seems to be an open redirect.
Thank you for your reports!

activities.message:
hello, thank you for this bounty but i still think this full account takeover with high severity and as you say that ("this can lead to a full account takeover, it requires unlikely user interaction the user would have to click on the "Reset password" that they did not generate themselves") and this is wrong for many reasons:

1 - when i use forwarded host header poison and change redirect to my host the email massage will send to victem from your main email address "noreply@newrelic.com" and this Enough to make user use this link


2 - as yous see this not requires unlikely user interaction , victem will use the link because it get from main email

3 - i can use many senarios to make user go to the reset link like make my host with name like newrelic.net instead of .com and user will clicked too 

4 - finally if you accepted this as host header poison or open redirect that you accepted it because you know that this leads to account takeover with high impact and if you accepted it with low or mediem i think maybe you will pay bounty with bonus for account takeover that harm user directily but i still think its high severity here please look at report againg and iam waiting your reply 

note : please look at this report with same impact at your program #498052 with severity high


thank you

activities.message:
Hi @masterhackor ,

Report #498052 is able to demonstrate request smuggling which can send a victim to a malicious website with NO user interaction at all. In your attack, a victim has to click a link on the reset password email *when they did not even request a new password* . The exploit-ability of this relies on a fair amount of social engineering. Therefore, we do not see this as anything more than a `Low`. 

Thanks again for the report and we're looking forward to more reports from you!
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @masterhackor ,

Report #498052 is able to demonstrate request smuggling which can send a victim to a malicious website with NO user interaction at all. In your attack, a victim has to click a link on the reset password email when they did not even request a new password . The exploit-ability of this relies on a fair amount of social engineering. Therefore, we do not see this as anything more than a Low.

Thanks again for the report and we're looking forward to more reports from you!

activities.message: Thank you can you update title to host header poison leads to account takeover

activities.message:
Hey @masterhackor ,

While this attack can be *chained* to achieve account take-over, the vulnerability itself is simply Host-header injection. I'll update the title accordingly.

Additionally - can you explain why the title change is important?
activities.markdown_message:
Hey @masterhackor ,

While this attack can be chained to achieve account take-over, the vulnerability itself is simply Host-header injection. I'll update the title accordingly.

Additionally - can you explain why the title change is important?

i want to ask you something you made next bugs with medium Severity and made my bug that leads to full account takeover with Severity low how ???????!!!!! and i will ask you if i report to you csrf that leads to account takeover you will make it with severity low too and say to me that  it requires unlikely user interaction ?!! i still think after i asked alot of  security researchers that this bug should be high

Medium severity bugs:
Cross-site scripting (XSS)
Cross-site request forgery (CSRF/XSRF) of a non-idempotent (AKA state-changing) request
Authorization flaws/Access Control Bypasses (e.g. being able to perform security-sensitive actions as a Restricted User)
Clickjacking on authenticated pages with sensitive state changes
Default New Relic agents collecting and sending undocumented confidential data to New Relic
Confidential data disclosure
 Cross-site request forgery (CSRF/XSRF) of a non-idempotent (AKA state-changing) request
Authorization flaws/Access Control Bypasses (e.g. being able to perform security-sensitive actions as a Restricted User)
Clickjacking on authenticated pages with sensitive state changes


thank you @dday

Thank you!
